Fields.DialogueText: *ALARM*
I can't get a moment's peace!
Get to the deck, Kapitan!
@BATTLE
Was everything okay back there, Moskva?
What do you mean?

Fields.MenuText: You seemed more sluggish than usual.
You looked distracted. Are you okay?
There's something off with you today, Moskva. You weren't as graceful as usual.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry about me, Kapitan. I was just... caught off guard.
Why wouldn't I be okay? You worry too much.
I'm always at my best, Kapitan.
You know you can tell me if anything is wrong.
I appreciate your concern, but I'm fine.
No, not now! This is no time to quit!
@BATTLE
*huff* *huff* Ahh... come on...
Moskva! What's wrong? Why aren't you moving?!
My legs...
Your legs?! Engineering, check the vessel! And get the medic!
NO!
Why not?
Let me fix this. I don't need help! I can... I can move...
Someone is already on their way, Moskva. Let me help you sit--
Do. Not. Touch. Me.

Fields.MenuText: I'm getting you the help you need, Moskva, whether you like it or not.
So we're just going to sit here and wait for the Morganas to find us?
I'm ordering you to cooperate, Moskva.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't need help!
I-I... I can fix this... I think.
You're damn stubborn, Kapitan!
Well? What's the status? Is she okay?
Her legs just gave out. She's straining herself too much.
Is she...?
She can walk, but that's it. We need to keep a tight rein on her. If she keeps pushing herself this hard, she may do real damage to her muscles.
It's that bad?
Moskva can barely feel her legs. We need to think about how to approach this.

Fields.MenuText: Engineering is checking the ship to see what caused it.
We need to stay on the defensive. I don't want Moskva to end up in worse shape.
Does she need anything from me?

Fields.DialogueText: Good. I'll head down to see if I can lend a hand.
I agree, although... Moskva may need persuading.
Whatever you do, Kapitan, Moskva is none too pleased with you.
*ALARM*
Let's get her to the deck.
@BATTLE
Kapitan, looks like we're about to test your new battle plan. Morganas ahead!
@BATTLE
How are your legs? I tried to keep us on the defensive so you wouldn't collapse on me.
Do not handicap me, Kapitan!
I'm concerned about your physical condition, Moskva.
I can still fight, Kapitan! I can look after myself! I don't appreciate your handling of the situation.
What was I supposed to do? Let you collapse?
You could've been subtler in your approach.

Fields.MenuText: I was worried about you, Moskva. It was a strange situation.
Next time your legs buckle, I'll just ignore you. That better?
Pride comes before the fall, Moskva.

Fields.DialogueText: I appreciate the concern, but I'd rather not show weakness in front of the crew.
What I mean is, help me, but don't embarrass me!
Pride keeps me alive, Kapitan. It could never take me down.
Noted. But sometime soon we need to talk.
*ALARM*
Kapitan, that last battle tanked our resources.
I was trying to take it easy on Moskva.
Do not do such things. It was a foolish endeavor, Kapitan.
We need to resupply.

Fields.MenuText: You're feeling well enough to hurry?
Just don't let your legs give out again.
Let's hurry then.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course I am, Kapitan!
Please, Kapitan, that was a one-time thing.
Finally. No more handicaps, understood?
I'll ready the crew.
Make sure you keep an eye on her, Kapitan.
Something wrong?
She's obviously low on steam. This isn't going to be easy.
If we see any Morganas, we'll sneak our way through.
Okay, people! Here we go again!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
So much for getting through unnoticed.
Kapitan, what do we do?!
We fight them, obviously.
Our supplies and our fuel is low.
I'm aware. Let's just try to get through this, shall we?
@BATTLE
Can I get a status report?
Low on everything, Kapitan.

Fields.MenuText: Try to hold on, Moskva. We're almost in the clear.
Are you scared?
Don't quit on me now, Moskva.

Fields.DialogueText: I will, Kapitan. I would ask that you proceed with caution until we refuel.
If anyone's scared, Kapitan, I'd bet it's you! This is nothing to me.
Me, quit? Don't make me laugh! Let's get moving!
We are gaining the advantage, Kapitan!
@BATTLE
More Morganas, Kapitan! (My legs... What is happening? Why can't I move them?!)
Moskva, get moving! We don't want them to get away!
We can take the shot from here!
Why don't we give chase?
Fire!!! (I can't move my legs... I can't feel them... Please, help!)
Direct hit! They're done for!

Fields.MenuText: How did you do that, Moskva?
Excellent shot.
Why can't you make shots like that all the time?

Fields.DialogueText: I could always make such shots, Kapitan.
Thank you, Kapitan.
What would the fun be in that? You don't like a challenge?
(I don't think I can do that again... My legs... )
*ALARM*
You shouldn't waste your time with ridiculous distractions, Moskva.
What else am I supposed to do? I'm the only Belle who can keep them from tearing each other to pieces!
Dispute?
Da. But not between us. Between two Belles.
What's the issue?
An Italian Belle isn't a fan of the ruling powers sweeping her nation. She and a German Belle crossed paths, and things escalated quickly. The crews are worried they'll start a brawl.

Fields.MenuText: How often do the Belles do this?
You're the Belle who settles disputes?
They should understand that the Morganas come first.

Fields.DialogueText: More frequently with each passing day, I'm afraid.
Do you have a problem with that? I'm quite good at calming them down. Or don't you believe me?
You think it'd be a simple thing to comprehend.
Do you need me to intervene?
We'll be fine, Kapitan.
Moskva! If you can hear me, meet me at the bridge!
I think we've got company coming!
@BATTLE
Sorry to intrude - I was going to check in on Moskva.
... I'm fine. Everything's fine except for this-
Some Belles are infuriating!
Having trouble with the Italian and the German?
Not really... They just don't appreciate their countries.

Fields.MenuText: What makes you say that?
Don't disrespect them, Moskva.
You think you're better than them?

Fields.DialogueText: They don't value their national traditions!
They disrespect the history of their homelands!
At least I love the way my nation is going!
So you believe that questioning your nation's ways means you don't like it?
Questioning your beliefs is a sign of weakness. They should be established already. People waste too much time thinking.
And you don't?
Of course not.
I do not think this battle will be easily won.
@BATTLE
Moskva, why are you hunched over? The battle is done. Get up.
Come close.
Huh?
Don't make a scene. Just come over here.
Okay, what's--
I can't get up. My legs aren't working. I can't move! I'm scared, Kapitan.

Fields.MenuText: I'm taking you down to the sick bay, Moskva. Lean on my shoulder.
I'll get engineering. We need to fix this fast.
I'm here to help. Come with me.

Fields.DialogueText: You're not moving me with the crew nearby!
I don't want the crew to see me like this.
No one can see us, understand?
No problem.
HURRY. LET'S MOVE!
Come on, Moskva.
*ALARM*
Morganas defeated! Everyone head down to the mess for some booze!
Engineer Trepanier, Kapitan. We haven't been introduced.
It's a pleasure, Trepanier. Now tell me, what's going on with Moskva?
She's been straining herself. And not only that: she's been rather combative with people attempting repairs.
Why's that?
I'm not sure, Captain. All I know is that she needs to let us fix the ship.
How's she for now?
For now she can fight, but we'll be at a disadvantage.

Fields.MenuText: I'll figure out why she's being so uptight, Trepanier.
How bad will this get if the problem isn't fixed soon?
You're dismissed, Trepanier.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Captain. I'll be on my way.
Ignoring this problem will get us all killed, Captain. Time is of the essence.
Yes, Captain.
(Better go and find Moskva... )
*ALARM*
They couldn't have come at a worse time.
@BATTLE
Battle stations! Everyone to the task at hand!
@BATTLE
What does she want me to do about it?! I'm not their mother!
Well, ma'am. She—
And why is she sending someone else to talk to me!? Why not come herself?!
Because she is too far—
I can see her from the deck! Hell, I could throw a rock at her from here! Now get lost!
You're throwing rocks at Belles now?
You overheard that? More Belles are arguing. Two Germans this time.

Fields.MenuText: Why do you put up with this?
Is the ship nearby one of the German vessels?
Let 'em fight it out. This isn't your problem, Moskva.

Fields.DialogueText: Because they are my sisters, Kapitan.
Yep. She sent an officer to do her dirty work. She's too ashamed to show her face.
I thought we all had a common enemy? Fighting amongst ourselves is idiotic!
What were the Belles fighting about?
An autographed copy of a book or something. It's so trivial!
Morganas, Kapitan.
@BATTLE
More enemies are closing in!
Get ready to—
No! I can... Ouch! My legs!
You're in no shape to fight! We're pulling back. Now!
Let me-- Why are my legs locked?! What's wrong with me!?

Fields.MenuText: This is no time to engage! You're in no condition, Moskva!
Prepare to retreat!
Come on, Moskva. I'll help you.

Fields.DialogueText: Fine!
I don't like this one bit.
I'll let you help... just this once.
*ALARM*
This is irritating! Legs, you're asking for a beating!
I hear music... and Moskva?
Ow! Why!? I trusted you, and you repay me with this!?
Who are you yelling at?
My legs! I can't dance ballet this way!
Really? Are you in pain right now?
No, I'm just not as limber.

Fields.MenuText: Don't push yourself too hard, Moskva.
Save your strength for fighting the enemy.
Recovery first. Dancing later.

Fields.DialogueText: I need to keep practicing! I can't get rusty!
I suppose you have a point, Kapitan.
I was trying to see whether dancing would loosen my legs. I guess not.
*ALARM*
Ready?
I guess so...
@BATTLE
Kapitan, Moskva is still moving awkwardly. The Morganas are using it to their advantage.
@BATTLE
Engineer Trepanier, Kapitan.
What do you need?
Moskva is still not letting me help her begin recovery.
How exactly is she preventing you from helping?
Threats of violence, mostly.  I don't want our greatest asset flying into a fury...
That's reasonable. So you want me to talk to her?
Warn her about the consequences of ignoring the issues with her legs.

Fields.MenuText: You want me to scare her? I don't think that'll work at all.
Do you realize who we're dealing with?
I'll just order her to cooperate. Easy as that.

Fields.DialogueText: You never know, Captain.
I do. Threats just might dent that armor of arrogance she wears.
Go ahead, Captain. Let me know how it works out.
*ALARM*
We need to talk.
About my legs?
Yes. About the engineers too.
Nothing is wrong! I'm just tired, I swear!
I don't think you're lying, Moskva. I just need you to cooperate with the engineers.
I would know if something needing fixing! He's simply trying to complicate matters!

Fields.MenuText: Can you just trust them, Moskva? Please?
I'm ordering you to cooperate.
We're all on the same side, Moskva.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know...
So I don't have a choice?
They will just complicate things.
*ALARM*
We'll have to table this discussion.
@BATTLE
Kapitan, we've hit multiple Morgana vessels.
@BATTLE
More Morganas!
I can take them out!
(My legs are starting to buckle. They're throbbing... )
Ready?
Do the honors, Moskva!
Fire!
(Please be a hit... I can't stand any longer... Don't fail me now, legs... )
Morgana down! Great work, Moskva!
All hands on deck! Morganas approaching!
@BATTLE
I wanted to update you on Moskva, Captain.
Has she let you examine the ship?
She's still hesitant, but tensions are easing. I did notice she's regained some of her strength.
I noticed we weren't so slow in recent battles.
I could speed things up with additional repairs to the vessel.
Think we can meet with Moskva?
It'd be a big help if you tagged along.

Fields.MenuText: Let's get going then.
This won't take too long, will it?
Hopefully she listens to you.

Fields.DialogueText: After you, Captain.
Hopefully not.
If she listens to anyone, it'll be you.
Captain, the Morganas are gaining on us.
@BATTLE
You think bringing the kapitan is going to change anything?
I know your legs are getting better, but--
I don't need any maintenance!
He could speed up your recovery, Moskva. Why are you being so stubborn about this?
It's a waste of resources.

Fields.MenuText: That's their job. It's not a waste of resources.
Every time we go into battle with you in this state, you risk the lives of everyone on board this ship. This is an order, not an option!
This'll be quick, Moskva. I promise.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't want them messing anything up!
Yes, Kapitan! Right you are.
It had better be.
Trepanier, do what you must.
Thank you, ma'am.
Kapitan, might I have a word after this battle?
@BATTLE
I was under the impression the engineer would be quick.
And?
And he brings all of his engineer friends with him! I'm not in bad shape as all that!
Who else did he bring?
Dixon, Marc, Jerry, Lynn, Caden, Glenn... the whole crew!

Fields.MenuText: That's a good thing, Moskva.
That means the job will get done faster.
You'll just have to grit your teeth and bear it.

Fields.DialogueText: It's an annoying thing.
You have a point.
Hmph!
They had better hurry it up.
I must admit, that my legs do feel better. And none too soon... Morganas approaching from the east!
@BATTLE
It's been loud near engineering lately. I wonder how Moskva is doing?
Oh boy, Moskva! You look really tired.
Why are they so loud!? How can I practice ballet in this ruckus?!

Fields.MenuText: You should rest between battles.
When did my favorite Belle become such a whiner?!
We're fighting an increasingly difficult enemy with low chances of survival, and you're upset over some noise?

Fields.DialogueText: I won't waste my time doing nothing!
I'm upset that I'm struggling, Kapitan!
Well, it is awfully loud...
It'll be over soon. Then everything will go back to normal.
I certainly hope so.
The Belles sure are relentless.
More disputes?
Just dealing with another Belle from my homeland.
What happened?
We have drastically different views on our nation. She doesn't like the direction we're heading.

Fields.MenuText: That's bound to happen, Moskva.
You got in a spat over that?
Just try not to turn any of our allies into enemies.

Fields.DialogueText: I just wish she respected the homeland as much as I do.
It's a serious matter, Kapitan. It's the future of my home!
Tell that to them.
She obviously feels strongly about it, or she wouldn't bother arguing with you. One could make the case that the debate just sharpens you both.
A debate between one who believes the world is round and one who believes the world is flat doesn't necessarily make either a better thinker.
... Would shooting Morganas make you feel better?
Probably not... but I'm willing to try.
@BATTLE
I feel amazing!
Moskva, are you okay?
Not only can I dance, but my legs feel incredible!
Sounds like you owe the engineers...
Oh, please!

Fields.MenuText: You know for a fact they sped up your healing.
Don't act like a child, Moskva. Thank them.
Swallow your pride.

Fields.DialogueText: I guess they did help... maybe a little...
Fine.
It's not pride, Kapitan. It's stubbornness...
Now if you'll excuse me...
Going to thank—?
Shut up!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I think we're back on top, Kapitan!
I'm glad you're back to normal, Moskva. Did you—
I did.
You thanked the engineers?
And I apologized for my behavior. Speaking of which... I should apologize to you for the same, Kapitan. I wasn't myself...

Fields.MenuText: No apologies necessary, Moskva.
Just don't do it again.
You owe me.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Kapitan.
I'll try not to.
I'll buy you a drink when this is all over!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I'm back to my old self. Let's show the enemy what we're made of!
@BATTLE
Now that we're in the clear, how about that drink?
Sure thing. Is this repayment for earlier?
Maybe I could also show you a few ballet moves to sweeten the deal.
You owe the engineers a drink as well, Moskva.
I guess you're right... so let's make a night of it!
Sounds like a party!
I'll get them. I hope they can hold their liquor...
I'm glad things are back to normal.
*ALARM*
